metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6810 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Apache ActiveMQ 5.x before 5.14.2, an instance of a cross-site scriptingvulnerability was identified to be present in the web based administrationconsole. The root cause of this issue is improper user data outputvalidation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

activemq - 5.14.2+dfsg-1
libactivemq-java - 5.14.2+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: activemq package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.14.2+dfsg-1').
